page.title: 14People & pastimes
page.content: The people of Shenley and Whaddon enjoy the village life of community, peace and open spaces. Some like the friendliness and others appreciate the privacy of this life style. Some look with apprehension on the encroachment of the new city, while others will welcome an improvement in the public transport and shopping facilities. Whaddon, outside the city boundary has a Brownie pack, a youth club and a Sunday school. The Shenleys which identify more with Loughton in the north are served by the WI, British Legion, an over 60s club, a cricket club an a dog training club. In both areas the churches and schools hold regular events such as fetes and bazaars. Popular activities include gardening, walking, horse riding, jogging & keeping fit. Children & adults spend time at clubs.
